provenance_domain.name: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing and Gene Expression Profiling of Pancreatic Circulating Tumor Cells

contributors.name: Elizabeth Christine Lee
contributors.affiliation: George Washington University School of Medicine & Health Sciences

usability_domain: Circulating tumor cells (CTCs) shed from primary tumors play a key role in tumor metastasis, yet the transcriptional profiling of CTCs has not been fully elucidated.  This workflow serves to undertake detailed analysis of the composition of pancreatic cancer CTCs using single-cell RNA sequencing followed by differential gene expression and gene-set enrichment analysis.  To achieve RNA-sequencing profiles of CTCs at the single-cell level, a high-throughput microfluidic cell-separation device was used for enrichment of CTCs, which were then subjected to single cell micromanipulation.  Gene expression profiles of single cell CTCs were compared with that of matched primary tumors in a mouse model of pancreatic cancer, which led to the identification of three distinct CTC populations, which clustered separately from primary tumors and tumor-derived cell lines and exhibited particularly high expression levels of extracellular matrix genes.  This BCO was created based on the workflow from Ting et. al.  doi: 10.1016/j.celrep.2014.08.029

pipeline_steps.name: TopHat

input_list.filename: UCSC Genome Browser mm9 knownGene Table

pipeline_steps.description: TopHat is a fast splice junction mapper that aligns RNA-Seq reads to a reference genome using the ultrafast short read mapping program Bowtie and then analyzes the mapping results to find exon-exon splice junctions.  This workflow used TopHat and Bowtie1 to align color space reads with the no-novel juncs argument set with mouse genome version mm9 and transcriptome defined by the mm9 knownGene table from genome.ucsc.edu.  If possible, each aligned read was mapped to its corresponding gene using the mm9 knownToLocusLink from genome.ucsc.edu.

pipeline_steps.name: Grid Graphics in R
pipeline_steps.description: Used for expression heatmap generation.  BD Biosciences Handbook was used for selection of established epithelial (Krt7, Krt8, Krt18, Krt19, Epcam, Egfr, Cdh1) and hematopoietic markers (Ptprc/Cd45, Csf3r/Cd114, Cd14, Fcgr3/Cd16, Itga2b/Cd41, Itgb3/Cd61).

pipeline_steps.name: RankProd (RP) Bioconductor Package
pipeline_steps.description: Used for the determination of false discovery rate (FDR) estimates for up and down differential expression of sequenced genes.

pipeline_steps.name: DAVID
pipeline_steps.description: DAVID provides a comprehensive set of annotation tools for functional interpretation of large lists of genes.  DAVID includes: KEGG (an integrated database used for biological interpretation of genome sequences and other high-throughput data), GO_BP (controlled vocabulary for classification of gene function and used to perform enrichment analysis for an independent biological process with a defined beginning and end), and GO_CC (controlled vocabulary for classification of gene function and used to perform enrichment analysis for a cellular structure).
